comments.commentBody: Please, will some patriotic public servant in the IRS, please, please leak Trump's tax returns already!

Where is Wikileaks when you need a release of restricted data! Trumps tax returns would keep Washington lawyers and accountants busy for years. God only knows how many dissertations would be written based on the shenanigans Trump has used to avoid paying taxes.

“He has these horrible views, but he’s sort of not vicious about them.”

Wow! My mind shudders as I wonder how many members of Congress might be similarly described. So he's kind of like the lovable dog that lifts his leg and pees on all your guests, but, hey, at least he doesn't bite them.

Trouble is, Sessions and others like him can always be elevated to positions where, yeah, they can be "sort of" vicious about their views.
Word.
Jeez, that all you got? Democrats not using exactly the same terminology?

@fg: When Godefroi Munongo, Katanga's interior minister was accused in early 1961 of having a hand in the kidnapping and assassination of Patrice Lumuma, he replied, "Prouvez le!"Obama spent hundreds of thousands of taxpayer dollars to send political strategists to Israel in a failed attempt to defeat Bibi Netanyahu, liberal media was deafeningly silent. Grow up. This is one world, and has been since the explosion of the first atom bombs near the end of WWII. Nations are always interfering in other nations' internal affairs. In 1970 US intervened in Chile to bring down democratically elected president,Salvador Allende in favor of a "golpe de estado"by a camarilla of right wing generals. We backed Operativo Condor, anti communist alliance of cone nations in Latin America, and were complicit in the car bombing murder of Orlando Letelier in  Washington DC in 1976 by Pinochet's DINA. 0ne of the car bombers, who put together the "engin infernal" which killed Letelier and an aide, Ronnie Moffitt, was an American, Michael Vernon Townley. So, who's kidding whom?

It was not THE EXACT SAME THING.  This is a photo from a public meeting with many other people taken ten years ago.  She wasn't "meeting" with the ambassador privately.  Chances are Pelosi meets with groups of people often, and it is very likely she did not recall this particular day ten years ago.  It is quite a different situation when Sessions said under oath that he had not met with the Russians when in fact he had met privately with the ambassador very recently.  These are not equivalent events.  Think of it this way--your spouse attends a meeting with a group of people in a public area ten years ago or your spouse meets a person privately in a hotel a month ago.  Are these equivalent?  Not the exact same thing.
Well, he just took the Federal government out of the suit to prevent Texas from changing voting rights, so, yes, he IS a "dedicated suppressor of civil rights".

Corruption? Hardly. Stacking odds for one candidate is just poor politics, a lack of foresight, all smothered in hubris. To be corrupt there would need to be some rules broken, and the DNC, like the RNC, is not operating as a entity under criminal laws.

Amazingly, the facts of the hacks, are nothing that special, nor very shocking had you been looking at how the DNC leadership was infatuated with HRC,and the prospect of the first female president. And a known-entity to many in the party, more importantly outside in the land of donors, and such.
Hey, give him credit for not liking Ted Cruz.
Thanks Gail. Sessions needs to be taken down a few pegs. And that accent! Shivers. Struthers Martin as the prison Warden. Creepy!
Accent?? Look up the definition of bigot. Then look in the mirror. And I think Sessions should resign or be fired. It would be the honorable thing, accent notwithstanding.

Not only is AG Sessions a racist, he proved himself to be a rather dense one at his confirmation hearing.   He needlessly perjured himself in trying to answer the question  "if anyone affiliated with the Trump campaign communicated with the Russian government” what would you do (as attorney general).  Rather than answer the question, Sessions looked like a deer in the headlights while admitting that he was "with the Trump, campaign" and he knew nothing about contacts with the Russians and further hung himself up (no pun intended) by saying he had no contacts with the Russians.  And we have this guy as the top law enforcement official in our country!  I don't think an Attorney General  who can't figure out how to answer a simple question without perjuring himself while under oath has any business in the Department of Justice.

"Anybody ...who wanted to be somebody stopped" etc......given your supposition, and if that was the case, it begs the question what was Kislyak's doing at Trump Tower before! the election.  Perhaps Mr. Sessions has the answer to that, or even Mr. Trump.

A fish rots from it's head. Trump sees nothing wrong with Sessions behavior because it mirrors his own. Trump's is rooted in arrogance, entitlement, indifference to integrity, ignorance and ego. Lying, conflating, misleading, embellishing, stealing credit, are all okay behaviors in Trump's eyes. He is the master. Sessions was merely mirroring Trump. That's why Trump sees nothing wrong with this picture. New precedents for Trump White house behavior are being set every day with this group.  From Kellyanne Conway coining the term "alternative facts" to Flynn's less than candid conversations with the VP Pence. Lying is okay. And Trump sees nothing wrong with it. So, the fish is rotting...and we can expect more of the same behavior going forward. They have no concept of shame...

yes, Trump is the rotten "head" and master of distraction. with" Session's met Russian" hot in the news, Trump tweeted that Obama administration "bugged " Trump Tower in October. oh, did he just find out now? how did these bugs installed in his "kingdom" without his people knowing/ or colluding ? have they been removed since he was elected ? why would Obama people removed them voluntarily ? wouldn't that keep on producing "juicy " stuff about Trump and his cohorts ?

this administration is taking our country down the drain into NEW cesspool.

This is absolute nonsense. You do know Stalin is dead, yes? So did you have a serious point at all? Nope, none at all.

Leave the deflection and lying to the Trump administration. After all, they're the experts at it. And if they keep it up long enough, there will be a body of lawbreaking on which even the Republican congress will have to take action.

Remember, most people who went to jail for Watergate were convicted of the cover up. Which seems to be cooking just fine in this scandal. Many of us pointed out that there would be real consequences for the total incompetence of Trump & Co. It would be quite a relief if those consequences were the end of Trump's presidency, rather than a shooting war with Iran or China, or a nuclear exchange with North Korea.

Trump is a dimwit with dimwits for advisers. Did it never occur to them that we monitor Russians for security issues constantly? They mindlessly are in contact with Russians during the election campaign and thus become part of the scenario of information about Russian activities.

Who do I trust more? Our intelligence community! Certainly not pathologically dishonest Trump, who surrounds himself with like-minded individuals. He babbles on and on about making America great while undermining it. Dumb.

Eclectic Pragmatism — http://eclectic-pragmatist.tumblr.com/
Eclectic Pragmatist — https://medium.com/eclectic-pragmatism

My vote goes to appoint a special prosecutor that will uncover much more than Sessions links with the Russians.

For additional torture, given his racist record as an Alabama prosecutor, I suggest a black or Latino woman special prosecutor.
Walker promised 250,000 new jobs at the end of his first term. He is in year 7 and still hasn't gotten them.
Scott Walker never listens to anyone but the right-wing cabal who have been controlling him for years.
Hey Scott, if 100,000 citizens were upset enough to protest, ever consider you're doing something wrong?
100,000 out of how many millions?

Yes, Mr. Walker. We will leave it to the states.
Consider Wisconsin gets back at least $1.60 for every $1.00 of taxes Wisconsinites send to Washington.
Perhaps you should have the freedom to pay for everything yourself?

Wasn't this the jbasic message of Republicans in 2008 and 2012 when it came to the election of President Obama?

Wasn't this the plan of Mitch McConnell, to ignore and stand against the voices of a majority of Americans as expressed in their votes?

Sounds like Walker has his hands deep in the mortar of building the stone wall against the will of the American people.
So Scott Walker thinks he and his allies took "the high road."  That's good for a laugh.  Few governors have ever been as vicious as Mr. Walker.
Strange that he's been overlooked by the White House.  Quick!  Get him a D.C. Job, so WI residents can breathe easy again.

" At 71, I'm going to a small village school at the foot of the Himalayas to teach. "

Good for you! As someone pushing 60 suffering from age discrimination in IT I love it when people like you demonstrate that age is nothing but a number.

"I'm going to love it, just by being on another continent from Scott Walker and Donald Trump."

I am thinking of going to Canada where there are plenty of unfilled IT jobs, but then again I will be on the same continent. Air and water pollution do not respect borders.

Once the USA returns to the state it was in during the 1930s I wonder if Canada will have to build a fence to keep Americans fleeing the smoking ruins of the USA out!

Scott Walker will not be satisfied until he turns the once proud University of Wisconsin into Trump University!

https://userctl.com/BlueVsRed/074.png
Well Lincoln did end slavery.

“He has these horrible views, but he’s sort of not vicious about them.”

Sounds like the typical Trump supporter.
